bibl.title: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, May 31, 1898

div1.p: Reed's station and duty report states that he was on duty as Curator of the Army Medical Museum during May 1898. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, May 31, 1898
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Report of Station & Duty.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
U. S. ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
Corner 7th and B Streets S. W.,
Washington, May 31, 1898. , 189 .
TO THE ADJUTANT GENERAL,
U. S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to report that during the month of May, 1898
I have been on duty in the Surgeon General's Office, as Curator of the
Army Medical Museum, in accordance with Par. 2, S.O., No. 153, dated
Headquarters of the Army, Adjutant General's Office, Washington, D.C.
July 7, 1893.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Walter Reed, Major & Surgeon, U.S.A.
Curator Army Med. Museum.
